intro: Monoon hirtum, commonly known as the hairy monoon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance.
